info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 27 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff AZ
info.description:
At 545 PM MST /645 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a thunderstorm with gusty winds near Page, moving northwest at 15 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hazardous boating conditions are expected on Lake Powell.
Locations impacted include... Page, Glen Canyon Dam, Wahweap, Page Municipal Airport, Antelope Island, Antelope Point Marina, Horseshoe Bend, Trapeze Cove, LeChee, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area, Golliard Park, Vermilion Cliffs National Monument and Lake Powell.
This includes U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 547 and 556.
This includes the following slot canyons... Stateline Wash.
This includes the following recreation areas and campgrounds... Wahweap Campground, Ropes Trail Camp Site and Ferry Swale Camp Site.
info.instruction:
Monitor the weather situation closely and be alert for threatening weather conditions.
If on or near Lake Powell, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
